de.esoco.lib.expression

Class CollectionFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.expression.CollectionFunctions

  • public class CollectionFunctions
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains factory methods for collection-related methods.

    • Method Summary

      • add

        public static <T,C extends java.util.Collection<? super T>> BinaryFunction<C,T,java.lang.Boolean> add(T rValue)
        Returns a new binary function that adds a value to an input collection.
        Parameters:
        rValue - The default value to add for unary function invocations
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • asList

        public static <T> InvertibleFunction<T[],java.util.List<T>> asList()
        Returns a function constant that wraps Arrays.asList(Object...). This method always returns the same function instance. The returned function implements the InvertibleFunction interface so that it can also be used to convert a list into an array.
        Returns:
        A constant function instance

      • clearCollection

        public static <C extends java.util.Collection<?>> Function<C,java.lang.Object> clearCollection()
        Returns a function that clears a collection.
        Returns:
        A function instance

      • collect

        public static <T,C extends java.util.Collection<T>> BinaryFunction<C,Predicate<? super T>,C> collect(Predicate<? super T> pCollect)
        Returns a new function instance that collects elements of a collection. Each element for which the given predicate evaluates to TRUE will be collected into a new collection of the same type as the input collection.
        Parameters:
        pCollect - The predicate to evaluate the collection elements with
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • collectAllInto

        public static <E,T extends java.util.Collection<E>,C extends java.util.Collection<E>> Action<C> collectAllInto(T rTargetCollection)
        Returns a new function instance that collects all elements of input collections into a target collection of the same type. The function returns the target collection to support concatenation.
        Parameters:
        rTargetCollection - The target collection
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • collectInto

        public static <T,C extends java.util.Collection<T>> Action<T> collectInto(C rCollection)
        Returns a new function instance that collects it's input values into a collection. The function returns the collection to support concatenation.
        Parameters:
        rCollection - The target collection
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • collectionSize

        public static <C extends java.util.Collection<?>> Function<C,java.lang.Integer> collectionSize()
        Returns a function that returns the size of a collection.
        Returns:
        A function constant

      • copyOfCollection

        public static <T,C extends java.util.Collection<T>> Function<C,C> copyOfCollection()
        Returns a function constant that creates a copy of a collection with the same type and contents. The input collection must be of a type that can be instantiated by reflection or else an exception will occur.
        Returns:
        A constant function instance

      • createList

        @SafeVarargs
public static <I,O> Function<I,java.util.List<O>> createList(Function<? super I,O>... rFunctions)
        See Also:

      • createList

        public static <I,O> Function<I,java.util.List<O>> createList(java.util.Collection<Function<? super I,O>> rFunctions)
        Returns a new function that creates a list of values from the result of applying several functions to an input object.
        Parameters:
        rFunctions - The functions to evaluate input objects with
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • createMap

        public static <K,V> BinaryFunction<java.util.Collection<V>,Function<? super V,K>,java.util.Map<K,V>> createMap(Function<? super V,K> fKey)
        Returns a new function instance that creates a mapping by deriving a key from the elements of an input collection into a new collection by evaluating them with a function. The entries in the resulting map will have the same order as the elements in the input collection.
        Parameters:
        fKey - The function to generate the map keys with
        Returns:
        A new binary function instance

      • createStringList

        @SafeVarargs
public static <I> Function<I,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> createStringList(boolean bMapNull,
                                                                                              Function<? super I,?>... rFunctions)
        See Also:
        createStringList(boolean, Collection)

      • createStringList

        public static <I> Function<I,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> createStringList(boolean bMapNull,
                                                                                java.util.Collection<Function<? super I,?>> rFunctions)
        Returns a new function that creates a list of strings from the result of applying several functions to an input object. This is a convenience variant of createList(Function...) that performs a string conversion on the result of each function evaluation. If the result of an evaluation is NULL and the boolean parameter is TRUE it will be mapped to an empty string, else the result will also contain NULL.
        Parameters:
        bMapNull - TRUE to map NULL values to an empty string
        rFunctions - The functions to evaluate input objects with
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • extractListElement

        public static <T> BinaryFunction<java.util.List<T>,java.lang.Integer,T> extractListElement(int nIndex)
        Returns a new function instance that extracts a certain element from a list. If the index is -1 the last element of the list will be extracted. Otherwise, if the given index is invalid for the input list a runtime exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        nIndex - The index of the element to extract or -1 for the last element in the list
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • extractMapValue

        public static <K,V> BinaryFunction<java.util.Map<K,V>,K,V> extractMapValue(K rKey)
        Returns a new function instance that extracts a certain value from a map. If there is no mapping for the given key in the map the function will evaluate to NULL.
        Parameters:
        rKey - The key of the value to extract
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • find

        public static <T,C extends java.util.Collection<T>> BinaryFunction<C,Predicate<? super T>,T> find(Predicate<? super T> rPredicate)
        Returns a new function instance that searches for a certain element in a collection. The returned element will be the first in the collection's iteration order for which the given predicate evaluates to TRUE or NULL if none could be found.
        Parameters:
        rPredicate - The predicate to evaluate the collection elements with
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • forEach

        public static <T,C extends java.util.Collection<T>> BinaryFunction<C,Function<? super T,?>,C> forEach(Function<T,?> rFunction)
        Returns a new function instance that evaluates each element of a collection with another function. The output value of the element function will be ignored. The output of the returned function will be the unchanged input collection.
        Parameters:
        rFunction - The function to evaluate the collection elements with
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • getListElement

        public static <T> BinaryFunction<java.util.List<T>,java.lang.Integer,T> getListElement(int nIndex)
        Returns a new function instance that returns an element with a certain index from a list. The list will be received as the function parameter. The returned function can also be used as a binary function to allow the use of variable indices. A variant of this function with a fixed list parameter can be obtained from getListElementAt(List).
        Parameters:
        nIndex - The index of the element to return
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • getListElementAt

        public static <T> BinaryFunction<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<T>,T> getListElementAt(java.util.List<T> rList)
        Returns a new function instance that returns an element from a certain list by it's index. This is a variant of getListElement(int) with swapped parameters.
        Parameters:
        rList - The list to return elements from
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • getMapValue

        public static <K,V> BinaryFunction<java.util.Map<K,V>,K,V> getMapValue(K rKey)
        Returns a new function instance that returns the value that is associated with a certain key from a map. A variant with swapped left and right parameters can be obtained from the method getMapValueFrom(Map).
        Parameters:
        rKey - The map key of the value to return
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • getMapValueFrom

        public static <K,V> BinaryFunction<K,java.util.Map<K,V>,V> getMapValueFrom(java.util.Map<K,V> rMap)
        Returns a new function instance that returns a value from a certain map. The key of the value to return will be the (left) input parameter of the returned function. This is the swapped parameter version of the function returned by getMapValue(Object).
        Parameters:
        rMap - The map to retrieve the value from
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • indexIn

        public static <T> BinaryFunction<T,java.util.List<? super T>,java.lang.Integer> indexIn(java.util.List<? super T> rList)
        Returns a new function instance that determines the index of an element in a certain list. See List.indexOf(Object) for details. The returned function can also be used as a binary function with receives as the second parameter the list from which the index of the element in the first parameter shall be determined.

        The function returned by indexOf(Object) works similar but with exchanged parameters.

        Parameters:
        rList - The list to return the index of an element therein
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • indexOf

        public static <T> BinaryFunction<java.util.List<? super T>,T,java.lang.Integer> indexOf(T rElement)
        Returns a new function instance that determines the index of a certain element in a list. See List.indexOf(Object) for details. The returned function can also be used as a binary function with has the element to get the index of as the second parameter.

        The function returned by indexIn(List) works similar but with exchanged parameters.

        Parameters:
        rElement - The element to return the index of
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • map

        public static <I,O,C extends java.util.Collection<I>> BinaryFunction<C,Function<? super I,O>,java.util.Collection<O>> map(Function<? super I,O> fMap)
        Returns a new function instance that maps elements of a collection into a new collection by evaluating them with a function.
        Parameters:
        fMap - The function to evaluate the collection elements with
        Returns:
        A new function instance

      • newList

        public static <T> Function<java.util.List<T>,java.util.List<T>> newList()
        Returns a function constant that creates a new list which contains the elements from another list that it receives as the input value.
        Returns:
        A constant function instance

      • reduce

        public static <T,C extends java.util.Collection<T>> BinaryFunction<C,BinaryFunction<T,T,T>,T> reduce(BinaryFunction<T,T,T> fReduce)
        Returns a new function instance that reduces a collection into a single value by evaluating all collection elements with a function.
        Parameters:
        fReduce - The function to evaluate the collection elements with
        Returns:
        A new function instance
